snippet: Senator John McCain said the agency followed a fair process that had been authorized by Congress and that it had the right to investigate and bring charges against Lance Armstrong.
abstract: Sen John McCain lends support to the United States Anti-Doping Agency in its case against Lance Armstrong, saying the agency follows a fair process that has been authorized by Congress and that it has the right to investigate and bring charges against Armstrong.
lead_paragraph: Senator John McCain said the agency followed a fair process that had been authorized by Congress and that it had the right to investigate and bring charges against Lance Armstrong.

headline.seo: U.S. Anti-Doping Agency Receives Support From McCain
headline.main: Day After Being Criticized, U.S. Anti-Doping Agency Receives Support From McCain
